Reviews.Title: Great Television for a Very Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: J. Brogden "SoulBoy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this televion once my old standard definition CRT television died right in time for the digital transition. After doing some comparison shopping I happened upon this TV and chose it to replace my old 19" CRT. The first thing you'll notice about this television is its relative weightlessness, while common for flat screens is a nice change from cumbersome CRT's. Also setup is very easy and once hooked up to an HD digital cable box through one of the two HDMI ports the picture quality difference is immediate.Initially the television was connected to my HD cable box via the coaxial port on the back of the TV. Surmised from many a HDTV review I expected standard definition shows to look worse once connected via HDMI but I guess going from coaxial (the bottom of the barrel) to HDMI (top of the line) provides an increase rather then decline, even in the visual integrity of standard definition shows and HD shows are on whole new level. Vibrant colors, nice crisp images and great line quality are the qualities sorely lacking from standard definition programing and televisions. Also I had no problems with the viewing angle what so ever. If I had to down this television for anything, it would be that the audio quality is lacking (an apparent hallmark of smaller flat screens) but i'd recomend an external speaker setup to remedy this. Besides that small nitpick this set has my stamp of approval.If you're searching for an HD-TV television that provides great value without sacrificing quality i'd fully recomend this set.

Reviews.Title: And so my TV hunt ends
Reviews.Author: Brian C "Bobazonski"
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a small TV to put in my bedroom and to double as a computer monitor. I put this in my Amazon cart when it was only $200, but it went up to $250, so I kept looking. Then I missed the Gold Box Deal of a Panasonic Viera 26" for only $250. (VERY disappointed) Later at Wal-Mart I stumbled upon this one again for $248 and decided to buy it and finally end my hunt. I'm a pretty generous rater on Amazon, but if I wasn't I'd probably give it a 3-star.What I like:- Works great as a computer monitor and automatically adjusts to the differing aspect ratio of my computer games- Two HDMI ports is nice for a small TV (I don't use them yet but I'm sure I will in the future)- Buttons are located on the side of the front panel within easy reach--you don't have to wrap your hand around.- Inputs and outputs located in the side are pretty deep--enough that the cords are easily concealedWhat I dislike:- The VIZIO logo glows white when on and can't be turned off (though it's pretty dim, not distracting), worse yet it glows orange when the TV's off. IT'S A TV, NOT A MICROWAVE. That can't be turned off either.- There is no letterbox zoom. So if you're wantching a widescreen program on a standard definition connection, the picture is stretched horizontally AND has horizontal bars.- Speakers are horrible. I don't care much because I have been plugging speakers in to the headphone jack.- No RCA audio out. You have to use the headphone and get a 3.5mm to RCA if you have a stereo or something similar. There is however an optical out for a home theater.- Remote is kind of cheap looking and is not universal (but this isn't expected on a small set).- Only one composite video--I know it's outdated, but it's still pretty common.- The only reason it's called an ECO TV is because it exceeds Energy Star guidelines by 15%. Woohoo. Big deal. For all I know, all LCD TVs do. I thought maybe it was made from recycled material or maybe NOT IN CHINA. (But that won't happen until pigs fly).List of inputs and outputs for those who are curious (It's so impossible to find online)HDMI in X2HDMI RCA audio inVGA in (RGB PC)PC audio in (3.5mm)Component + audio inCoaxial inComposite video/S-Video + RCA audio (all on side)Optical/SPDIF outHeadphone out (on side)There is also a 3-prong (looks like DC power kinda) connection that says SERVICE as well as one that is USB.Overall--great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the price.
Reviews.Author: Spriz "Spriz"
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a relatively inexpensive HD television to replace a small 13" RCA CRT in the bedroom.  Since we already own other Vizio equipment that we are quite happy with, we decided on this model.  It has a good assortment of inputs:  2 HDMI, VGA, Component, Composite, SVideo, and coax.  We've found the picture quality from both our HD cable box and our Blu-Ray player to be very nice via HDMI.  We haven't experienced any viewing angle issues.  SD signals are generally good as well.  There is some fuzziness, but that's normal when viewing SD content on an HD set.  Most of the time it's barely noticable.  The sound, however, is not as good.  It sounds a bit hollow and tinny, no matter how we adjust the bass and treble.  I think our old RCA actually had better sound, and that's the only thing that stops me from being able to give the Vizio 5 stars.In short, if you can get around the slightly dissappointing sound, the VA220E is a very good choice if you're looking for a smaller HD set with a lower price tag and an excellent picture.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV - Vizio quality!
Reviews.Author: rjv
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for my 13 year old after repainting his room and kicking out his younger brother. The picture is clear and very vibrant. Side and angle viewing is also good. The audio has an SRS surround mode which sounds great at higher levels. At low levels it can be a bit empty with little bass but if you turn it up great spatial sound comes through. Remember, when you are looking at these TV's at your local WalMart what you are seeing is a direct feed digital signal, DO NOT expect this kind of quality unless you have high def reception or are watching a DVD. Also, depending on how your cable provider sends it's signal you may still see black bars on the top and bottom of the pictue. I spoke with Vizio Support about this and they were very helpful and explained. To be honest, my old 19inch CRT still has a bigger and better picture for normal television viewing!

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: J. Oakes
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV for the price.  Good Picture.  Easy to set up.  My only complaint is that it only has 1 RCA input.  I have to disconnect and reconnect my son's different game systems.  It also has 1 component, 1 serial, and 2 HDMI inputs.

Reviews.Title: Like the picture, would like an output
Reviews.Author: Kodachrome man
Reviews.Content: Has a very nice picture and the tuner, on rabbit ears,  does a better job than the 13" analog TV it replaces.  I see reviewer said it has poor off angle viewing but that is definitely not true on the unit I have.  Also read a review elsewhere that thought off angle viewing was good.  Sound is not as good as my 42" panasonic but its a fraction of the cost and size, its good for what it is.  Much more viewable picture size than a 19" would be in the office where I have it.  Would like to see an output for a recorder.

Reviews.Title: gl2814
Reviews.Author: J. A. Prince
Reviews.Content: This Set replaced a 13" Samsung flat tube that was great in its day.  So far, great trouble free set. DVD's look solid and I'm not using HDMI.  Plan on adding blu-ray and will consider Vizio in the mix when I do.  Only viewing angle problems experienced when looking up from floor.  From the bed or a chair no problems at all.  Sound is a little lacking but fine for the bedroom. An outstanding buy for the money.  Found my set at Walmart and the price has dropped since purchase. Amazon pricing is pretty close.  Recommend where HD is desired, but you don't have the room for a 37" or 42".

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: D. Krysl "Cinephile"
Reviews.Content: This is my first bedroom TV, previously all I'd watched was an older Tube TV. I was a little hesitant to buy Vizio at first because I hadn't heard about it before. I bought new and all my fears are allayed. I haven't had any technical problems at all. Simplest setup in the world, you just put on the stand, connect a few cables, and you're good to go.Even though this TV is only 720p, Blu-ray still looks incredibly crisp and it's an obvious upgrade from DVD. Many people told me I wouldn't see the difference on a small screen like this, but if your vision is good enough (mine's about average), you will. The black levels are pretty good, you might want to turn on the Black Level Extender in any case. A few people complained about the remote, but I really like it, it's got an ergonomic shape and fits nicely in your hand. In the back there is a headphone jack, but because of the way the TV is molded, my Sennheiser plug doesn't fit. That bothered me, but I found a way around it by just connecting straight to the BD player.I can't say much for the sound because I have my Logitech speakers hooked up from my Blu-ray. I'd imagine not many people are going to be using the default speakers, anyway.The only thing I wish it had is more options for aspect ratio. I believe anamorphic widescreen is not one of the options, I had to set that up on my BD player.Overall: highly recommended! This TV is a joy to use and a great bargain. If you have any questions, let me know.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: T. Bellhorn
Reviews.Content: This is an excellant tv for a small apartment or a bedroom.  Picture is great and it is very easy to work with.  We bought this for my fathers bedroom after he had a brain injury and he finds it very easy to figure out.

Reviews.Title: Good value ok picture
Reviews.Author: Steve from Pueblo
Reviews.Content: inexpensive TV with below to average picture quality must sit directly in front to enjoy good picture...on the other hand has very good sound quality for a TV in this price range..remote is  cumbersome volume and channel control seem backwards,

Reviews.Title: LASTED FOR ABOUT 9 MONTHS!
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV 9 months ago.  The display has light spots and concentric circles on it.  Vizio had me send photos and their technicians have determined that it is defective and must be replaced.  As it is still under warranty, I have been instructed to ship it back (AT MY EXPENSE!).  Further, I have been told I will receive a replacement in an already opened box, as it will be reconditioned or in some other way, not "new".  I am disgusted with the fact that1) a new TV does not work after 9 months,2) I must pay to ship it back3) it will be replaced with something in an open box that will come with a new set of problems.

Reviews.Title: Birthday present for my son
Reviews.Author: J. L. Ellis
Reviews.Content: The price was better than anything else I found on the internet or any stores.  I received it four days after ordering it.  Everything was perfect as far as packaging, look and performance of tv

Reviews.Title: Vizio VA220E LC Television
Reviews.Author: G. Logsdon
Reviews.Content: The picture and sound quality are very nice.  I use the TV in a small room and have it placed in front of my treadmill.  One thing I really appreciate is the sound, without being enhanced, is strong and clear enough that it can be heard over the treadmill sound; and the volume isn't all the way up.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the money
Reviews.Author: A. Williams "donut guy"
Reviews.Content: The TV is a good size for a bedroom or kitchen.  The sound quality is good, it actually seems loud based on the volume number that is displayed on the screen.  The resolution is good the only problem I have is the color.  It seems that you work on the color on one channel and get it dialed in how you like and then when you change the channel the new channel's color is off.  Needless to say I have dialed down the color which ultimatley makes the picture quality not as sharp as it should be.  This is a TV that we only watch about an hour a day of programming so I was not too upset with the color options.  Overall an OK buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: My second Visio HDTV
Reviews.Author: Margaret A Smeltzer
Reviews.Content: I have a 32 inch Visio in my living room and am quite pleased.  So I bought the 22 inch for my sewing room.  They are a terrific value and have found them quite dependable.

Reviews.Title: I love it...
Reviews.Author: ThaKoRnKiD "Tha KoRn KiD"
Reviews.Content: My wife brought me to Walmart, walked me over to the electronics section, and to my surprise we stopped in front of the 22 inch tvs and she said go ahead, pick one. I chose this 22 inch Vizio. It was either this or an RCA. I have an RCA tube tv and have always been impressed with the life span of that tv, considering I've had it since 2001 and it still works jsut like the day I bought it. I liked the picture quality in store on the Vizio over the RCA and liked the fact that it has 2 HDMI ports over the RCAs 1. I took a chance and boubght the Vizio, brought it home, plugged it in, scanned for over-the-air channels, and the moment I seen CBS in High def, my jaw dropped. The picture quality is cleaner and crisper than anything I've ever seen before, and the sound is just as good! I have an Xbox 360, and composite cables so I dont get the full High def experience, but it looks amazing just through those cables. Lucky for me, I just recieved my HDMI cables I bought for like 3 bucks here on AMazon, and get to see what its like later :). I definately recommend this tv to anyone who's doubting Vizios quality or lcd line. Oh, and be smart, buy an extended warranty like I did...I hear all of these complaints about people buying expensive tvs, and then having them break down a month after the manufacturer warranty...HELLO!!!!If your goinna spend 500 bucks on a tv, buy extra coverage!!!

Reviews.Title: Poor Lifespan
Reviews.Author: Paul Rice
Reviews.Content: Purchased this VA220E about 1 1/2 years ago. The screen just went blank overnight. The Vizio logo lights up, but no picture of any sort. Vizio wants to have me send it to CA for repair. the estimated repair cost is $110.00 plus shipping. I am very disappointed in the short life of this product. I was a very strong advocate of the brand but not any longer. I am very concerned about the lifespan of my other units now.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO VA220E HDTV POOR QUALITY
Reviews.Author: jbmaio
Reviews.Content: My main problem with this TV is the picture quality. The vertical viewing angle is awful, I have this TV wall mounted and unless you are looking straight at the TV the picture is washed out or black depending on the degree of the viewing angle (10 to 30 degrees). I contacted Vizio and they told me it was within specs. Sorry Vizio but I would never recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: ZERO negatives
Reviews.Author: Andrew's Dad
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an old analog tv in my boat. Read ALL the reviews about this new Vizio LCD and thought that it would work out fine, especially for "The Money". Before I took it out to the marina, I thought I had better test it, to make sure there was not any problems...(Based upon the outside condition of the box, shipping had not been very kind). Setting it up in my wife's study, I looked to identify the "Cons" I had read about. To my suprise, I COULD NOT FIND ANY. Unfortunately, I now need to buy another one, as "SHE" wants to keep it.

Reviews.Title: Okay for the price...
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: This TV (a Vizio 22" va220e LCD) is okay for the price I paid ($200)... The color is a bit above average, but the sound is horrible! I've heard some mini PC speakers that sound better. I use this TV in the bedroom, and it suffices. So, if you're looking for an LCD TV of this size, I'd recommend you find one with better sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Never again
Reviews.Author: Creative 1 "Claymud"
Reviews.Content: When I bought this tv 8 months ago after reading reviews, I thought I had purchased a good and economical second tv. The sound was so poor that I hooked up computer speakers to it, which helped.  The picture was acceptable, but not great.  All went well for 8 months and then one day it would not turn on.  I called Vizio and after testing, they told me I had to fax a receipt to them and then they would tell me how to SEND the tv back to them for repair.  I asked if I could take it to our local dependable repair facility, and they said "No.".  I called the facility and they said they do not work on Vizio.  So then, I had to decide whether to spend the money for fax, box and padding and shipping costs and then worry that it could be smashed in shipment.  And I would have to wait at least 3-4 weeks for return.  I went back to the store to see if they would ship it back, and they would if it were under a 90 days purchase.  They also said that people returned Vizio TVs more than any other brand.  Many of them stopped turning on, so I think Vizio has a defective part in them.  I do not recommend Vizio (lost about $300 with it) and now have purchased a SONY, which cost the same as the Vizio for the same size TV.  I am very happy, because the Sony has a better picture and sound without the extra speakers.

Reviews.Title: vizio va220e
Reviews.Author: D. W. Cason
Reviews.Content: Had to return this TV.  Set-up was easy, however, picture quality was poor.  This may have been due to poor cable transmission, but could not adjust the set to where it was watchable.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Trish
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a year now.Still works great with daily use.Picture and sound quality are very good.

Reviews.Title: As expected
Reviews.Author: Obama
Reviews.Content: Overall I am satisfied with this tv. The power cord was missing on arrival. It is what I expected it to be, no big surprises, except the power cord missing. It was a good deal that I could not find any where else.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, and a Nice Monitor Too
Reviews.Author: Jack of all Trades, Master of None
Reviews.Content: Got this to use while my larger Vizio was to get repaired, well turns out my other Vizio just had a bad HDMI cable. But this works so good as my laptop monitor, I use it to watch tv at my desk, as my monitor, and have it connected to my Blu-ray DVD player. A nice little addition.

Reviews.Title: vizio mid size tv
Reviews.Author: P. Danesi "grandfather of 6"
Reviews.Content: great product and low price. First time purchase from amazon's returned product warehouse. Product was like brand new but at a savings of at least 30%. product performance excellent, manual even gives you the control code updates to program comcast HDTV remote. have it wall mounted on my summer house porch and have gotten many compliments.

Reviews.Title: used visio tv
Reviews.Author: Deborah K. Simonen "mema"
Reviews.Content: i received the tv before promised due date, and if it was used there is no way to tell it is in perfect condition all the books and parts and all wrapped perfectly wow what a deal!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! LOVE IT,CONDITION, PICTURE AND SOUND ALL EXCELLENT

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: R. goodwin
Reviews.Content: as a retired person i dont want special features. this tv works perfectly right out of the box. everything functions well and setup was a snap. perfect for old people. just plug it in and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO VA220E
Reviews.Author: K. Armstrong
Reviews.Content: This TV has a really great picture.  It is the right size for my bedroom.  There is a problem with the sound.  The sound on the digital channels is lower than the regular channels.  When I turn it up for the digital, it is then too loud for the regular channels.  It is something I can put with, but is an annoyance.  Don't know if this is true of all of the tv's of this model.  Vizio says this is because of our cable system, but my other two LCD's do not have this problem.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Unforgettable
Reviews.Content: The TV is awesome! I bought it for my son's room, and it looks perfect!! I love the timer feature as well.  AWESOME buy!

Reviews.Title: Good Deal!
Reviews.Author: Dad_arch
Reviews.Content: After seeing the other reviewer's comments on this TV and the great price....my wife and I decided to purchase this TV for our bedroom.  It has met our expectations!  The picture quality is pretty good.  Please note that it does have a thick black frame around the screen and the center "Vizo" sign does light up white when ON and orange when OFF. (However, we didn't mind it like other reviewers.)  The only con's we do have with the Vizio TV is the remote controller with channel & volume buttons on the opposite side that we are used to and the volume on the TV is not as great as our other TV. As a second TV --it works!!!!

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: R. Sicily
Reviews.Content: Great price, rapid free shipping Very easy to setup and operate. Picture is sharp with good color. Audio is good, acceptable.

Reviews.Title: visio 22 inch
Reviews.Author: Harper C. Hodges
Reviews.Content: I liked it.  It was useful for a video project I was working on for school, and easy enough to use that I could alter settings on the fly while the project was playing.  On the plus side I needed a new computer monitor, which this works almost perfectly.  Sometimes the horizontal and vertical positioning is off when I play games, but it hasnt been much of a hassle to fix.  Another plus is the inclusion of a headphone jack in the event you need to listen quietly, not a feature easy to find in TVs

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Heather P "Heather"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this after my other flat panel was going and I was looking for value and quality.  Saw this when actually ordering something else on Amazon.  Great price and great TV!

Reviews.Title: SUPER FAST DELIVERY NICE TV
Reviews.Author: T. Bardsley
Reviews.Content: I received this tv today LESS than 24 hours  after I ordered it!  Nice lookong tv.....the  sound in the bedroom area  is fine,  picture very good,  number of  indoor antenna channels  incredible,  very  good deal  great price.  BTW  the  yellow  glow and  white  glow very subdued  ALL tv's  have  a light now....

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price!!
Reviews.Author: AB
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this VIZIO HDTV. I have never owned a VIZIO before and I am definitely sold on the brand!! I was very fortunate to time the purchase right when Amazon had the TV for $209, now it's $228. It would still be a good value at $250 though. Free standard shipping only took 3 days. Opened the box, hooked up my cable, plugged it in and about 10 minutes later it had detected all my channels, including HD channels. The picture is fantastic for my HD channels and very good for the non-HD. I don't see any negatives for this TV other than maybe the channel and volume controls on the remote are reversed from most remotes. No big deal though. Definitely a great value!

Reviews.Title: Vizio has great Lcd tvs.
Reviews.Author: queenlaker
Reviews.Content: Don't let others change your mind on this vizio 22' inch tv. i bought this tv for my gr8 nephew picture shows great, volume is wonderful not tiddy as a buyer said.And vizio placed an Hdmi cord inside the packaging.I notice the stand is different now reminds you of the stand on the samsung tvs.The older stands are wider. Factory settings are great unless you want to tune down your colors

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: The product came on time and was in excellant condition. It works great and I love using it!

Reviews.Title: Perhaps too good to be true.
Reviews.Author: Helen "Magehelen"
Reviews.Content: At least I can receive stations without cable or satellite charges every month, but the sound is annoying (very flat) and the operation is very frustrating.  The onscreen menu is so small I must stand right in front of it to see it, and each setting has it's own peculiarities.  Sometimes I can change the wide screen to normal, sometimes I can't. I would like to get additional speakers, but I can't find anything with appropriate connections in an acceptable price range. I rarely receive constant, even reception.

Reviews.Title: It's OK... not great
Reviews.Author: L. F. Castillo
Reviews.Content: It's not a bad TV.  The sound isn't the best but I guess that's what you get for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 22" television
Reviews.Author: Sandra A. Wagner
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the TV.  I was pleased with the quickness of shipment.

Reviews.Title: Needs improvement
Reviews.Author: JULIE SAUER
Reviews.Content: You only get a good picture if you are right in front of it.  If you move to either side, the picture changes drastically for the worse...  Sound is tinny...

ProductInfo.Features:
Energy Star compliant
22-Inch LCD HDTV (21.6 diagonal viewing area)
High Definition 1366 x 768 Native Resolution
5,000:1 Contrast Ratio for darker blacks
Includes 2X HDMI inputs
ProductInfo.Name: VIZIO VA220E 22-Inch ECO 720p LCD HDTV
